Posts.Content: BlondeGenie wrote: Hi, I'm 34.  I've had a mammogram and ultrasound and they found a growth in a milk duct.  The reason that I went to the Dr was for smelly nipple discharge.  Seriously bad smell, like foot odour.  I can't find anything about the smell of the discharge.  My discharge is like a yellow fluid and can vary in how much.  I wear a thin liner in my bra because sometimes it leaks through to my clothes and the liner helps with the smell.  Can't feel a lump, the growth is tiny. I'm on a surgical wait list to have the growth removed, but was just wondering if anyone else has experienced a similar smelly discharge and what your outcome was? Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Nipple discharge with bad smell BlondeGenie BlondeGenie

Posts.Content: Apr 9, 2012 02:45PM BlondeGenie wrote: No fever, just an occasional ache in the breast, sometimes itchy and nipple tenderness, the nipple has turned in slighly too.  I originally though it was an infected milk duct and have mentioned it to the Dr.  They think it's the growth producing the discharge.
Posts.Title: Nipple discharge with bad smell BlondeGenie BlondeGenie
